moves.1. e4: Nothing out of the ordinary for the first few moves....
moves.1... c5: I plump for the Sicilian, i find it pretty flexible and is probably my fav to play as black...
moves.3... e6 4. c3: A very popular move among top flight players as well as us lowly folk....
moves.4... Nf6: No chance of Bg4 pinning me to my Queen so i go for the old Nf6 shuffle....
moves.5. d3: I spoke too soon it seems...
moves.6. O-O Be7 7. Bf4 d6 8. Bb5: Seizing the opportunity to pin me...
moves.8... Qb6: I want an instant decision as to the future of that bishop...
moves.9. Bxc6+: And that decision is provided, I don't mind this little arrangement. At this point everything is about equal developmentally speaking and positionally. No commitments have been made as yet...
moves.9... Qxc6 10. b3: The old pawn advance heading my way, however this move does hinder the white queen a little and if my opponent isn't planning on keeping it there why not move to b4 in 1 foul swoop?
moves.10... e5: So i make room for my Qbishop and also attack his. Notice how i still haven't committed to castling yet on either side, hopefully this serves as a source of a little annoyance to my opponent.....
moves.11. Be3: Support for the d push maybe...
moves.11... Bg4: What the hell, it is annoying...
moves.12... Bh5: I decide to try and keep the pin going for as long as i can....
moves.13. Nbd2: And that's the end of that...
moves.13... b6: Strengthening my pawn chain a little, whilst i still have the time..
moves.14. Qc2 O-O: With that last pawn move obviously I had committed to a king-side castle slide....
moves.15. Rfe1 Bd8: I wanted to line up this Bishop with h2, it wasn't doing much where it was and i felt when the big pawn exchange happens it will be a dangerous diagonal to own..
moves.16. Nh2: Prep for a little Nf1-Ng3 jig....
moves.17... d5: Now is as good a time as any to open up the centre, especially with that last knight move...
moves.18. Ng3: Carrying on with the original plan, which is what they say you should do, distractions can cost dearly...
moves.20... Nxe4: I figure I may aswel go the whole hog, I should end up with a dangerous position if nothing else....
moves.21. Nxe4 Bxe4: This move being the logical ending to that little sequence of play wins me another pawn and opens a direct line to the white king...
moves.22. Qb2 Bxg2: Splitting open the kings defence and exposing him to the harsh realities of life....
moves.23. c4: Not the move i would have played....
moves.23... Bxh3: Now i issue multiple terminal threats.....
moves.24. Ng3: I was flabbergasted when i logged on and saw this move, but i see why. My opponent must have anticipated Qg6+ totally missing the real threat.....
moves.24... Qg2#:
And there it is, at the time of playing i was pretty happy with this win, having gone back through it my opponent made some pretty bad choices along the way but unless i hadn't made the right choices then this game wouldn't have been such a easy win...So hey ho, i've annotated it now so it's going out!

Cheers.
